p: The benzazole scaffold is widely distributed in nature, e.g., benzothiazole ( 9), benzimidazole ( 10), and benzoxazole ( 11) are considered essential core structures of many biomolecules such as in firefly luciferin ( 12), a benzothiazolyl derivative exhibiting bioluminescence [ 17] and a benzimidazole moiety exists as an axial ligand for cobalt in vitamin B12 ( 13) [ 18] ( Figure 1).
